campaign.description: Basic walkthrough of Command Center features - first steps after claiming listing

landing_page.ai_goal: Guide user through first actions confidently

slides.title: Welcome to Your Command Center

content.headline: Your Command Center in 10 Minutes
content.subhead: Everything you need to know to get started

slides.narration: Welcome to your Command Center. In the next ten minutes, you're going to learn everything you need to navigate confidently and take your first actions. This is beginner-friendly—no tech skills required. Let's get you set up.

slides.title: The Five Areas

areas.name: Your Profile
areas.desc: How you appear to the world

slides.narration: Your Command Center has five key areas. One: Your Profile—this is how you appear to the world. Two: Your Content—where you create and manage posts, events, coupons, and news. Three: Your Insights—where you see who's viewing and engaging. Four: Your Messages—where inquiries and conversations come in. Five: Your Settings—where you set preferences and connect other tools. Let's look at each one.

slides.title: Your Profile

content.headline: Step 1: Complete Your Profile
content.completion_indicator: Aim for 100% - complete profiles get 3x more views

slides.narration: Start with your profile. Click 'Profile' in the left sidebar. You'll see fields for your business description, profile photo, contact info, hours, and services. Here's a pro tip: complete profiles get three times more views than incomplete ones. Take five minutes now to fill in everything. Two to three sentences for your description is plenty. A logo or storefront photo works great.

slides.title: Your Content

content.headline: Step 2: Create Your First Content

content_types.use_for: Something happening at a specific time

content.recommendation: Start with an Announcement - it's the easiest

slides.narration: Next, let's create your first content. Click 'Content' in the sidebar, then 'Create New.' You'll see four options: Announcements for news about your business, Events for things happening at specific times, Coupons for special offers, and Articles for longer stories. My recommendation? Start with an announcement. It's the easiest—takes about two minutes. Just say what's new, what you're excited about, or what customers should know.

slides.title: Your Insights

content.headline: Step 3: Understand Your Insights

key_metrics.meaning: How many people saw your listing
Clicks, shares, saves on your posts
How often you showed up in searches

content.check_frequency: Check weekly to start, then monthly once patterns emerge

slides.narration: Your Insights area shows you what's working. Click 'Insights' in the sidebar. You'll see profile views—how many people saw your listing. Content engagement—clicks, shares, saves on your posts. Search appearances—how often you showed up when people searched. And inquiry rate—how many viewers actually contacted you. Check this weekly at first. Once you see patterns, monthly is fine.

slides.title: Your Messages

content.headline: Step 4: Set Up Messages

features.desc: Email or SMS when messages arrive

content.action: Set up your auto-response now - takes 2 minutes

slides.narration: Messages is where customer inquiries come in. Click 'Messages' in the sidebar. You get a unified inbox—everything in one place. You can save quick replies for questions you answer often. And here's what I recommend setting up right now: your auto-response. When someone messages you and you can't reply immediately, they automatically get a response saying you'll be in touch soon. Takes two minutes to set up. Go to Messages, click Settings, and write your auto-response.

slides.title: Your Settings

content.headline: Step 5: Key Settings to Check
content.note: Most defaults are fine - just check notifications

slides.narration: Finally, Settings. Click 'Settings' in the sidebar. The most important thing to check: notification preferences. Make sure you're getting notified when inquiries come in—by email, SMS, or both. You can also connect social accounts here for auto-posting, add team members if you have staff who need access, and view your plan and billing. Most defaults are fine. Just make sure notifications are set up so you don't miss anything.

slides.title: You're Ready

content.headline: You're Ready to Go
content.next_steps: Next up: How to create content that gets found →

slides.narration: That's it. You know your way around. Your checklist: complete your profile, create your first content, bookmark your insights, set up auto-response, and configure notifications. Click 'Go to Your Command Center' to put this into action right now. Or if you want to see it all in action first, watch the video walkthrough. Next up, we'll show you how to create content that actually gets found. You've got this.
